intro: Hechtia elegans, commonly known as the elegant hechtia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The plant produces vibrant orange or red flowers that bloom from the center of the rosette. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light. Hechtia elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to indoor environments.
